title: [Large-Scale] Knowledge Graph Construction and Utilization for Cybersecurity Response Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental cybersecurity concepts, RDF data representation, basic understanding of graph theory
context.additional_context: Learners have experience responding to cybersecurity threats in real work environments and aim to establish efficient threat detection and response strategies using knowledge graph-based analysis tools.

learning_goals: Learners can identify core components of a knowledge graph—entities, relationships, and semantic connections—with 80% accuracy.
Learners can preprocess cybersecurity data in RDF format and perform the conversion to SPO triplets with 90% accuracy.
Learners can predict missing security response facts with 75% accuracy using embedding-based representation learning models (e.g., TransE, DistMult).
Learners can analyze complex cybersecurity threat scenarios within five steps using knowledge graph visualization tools.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
